column17: IS militants had destroyed an armoured vehicle carrying troops in Djebel Mghila area in an IED attack. At least one soldier was injured.
Young people from Regueb organized a protest march to call for employment and development in the region.
Protesters installed tents to start a sit-in in front of the SIAPE-factory near Gabes.
An IED blast by ISIS wounded two soldiers in the area of Jebel Mghila.

The head of the national police station in Sousse was assaulted by an individual. The latter who had parked his vehicle in front of the police station was arrested for an identity check by the head of the security institution. He refused the order and physically assaulted the head of national police, which necessitated his transfer to the hospital.

column8: Military Forces of Tunisia (2014-2019) National Guard
column17: Rioters clashed with security forces from the National Guard with the National Guard using teargas to disperse the rioters. The rioters were initially protesting for more street safety after a 12-year old street vendor died in a car accident. 16 agents from the National Guard were injured and 5 cars damaged. 15 rioters were arrested.
Tunisian families gathered on Thursday outside the headquarters of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs to demand the repatriation of their children that are imprisoned in Libya.

Protesters blocked the port at Sidi Youssef, preventing ships from debarking. The protesters were demonstrating against the arrest of 2 two fishermen that, according to the National marine, violated fishery law.

Agreement: An agreement has been signed between the government and protesters blocking oil and petrol production in the southern Kebili region, after more than four months of sit-ins over unemployment and lack of development.

Rioters attacked the border post Bouchebka in Feriana after a dispute between one Tunisian and one Algerian guest at a wedding. The Algerian crossed the border which led several Tunisian rioters to attack the post. Police had to intervene to disperse the assailants.
Policemen in Kairouan protested to condemn the death of one of their colleagues who was earlier this driven over by a smuggler on the run.
The Tunisian armed forces shelled suspected militant positions with artillery yesterday at Jebel Semmama, Kasserine.

A simple dispute between three individuals in a cafe in the town of Tataouine turned into a fight and tribal conflict, when the belligerents called for members of their families to join them. The two tribes clashed extensively, on Wednesday night, with swords, clubs and other projectiles, causing many wounded on both sides. The police had to resort to tear gas to separate the two clans. Two of the three individuals responsible for the fighting were arrested and detained at Harboub prison.

column6: Military Forces of Tunisia (2014-2019) National Guard
column17: Arrests: Yassine Kanouni, a prominent member of the Okba Ibn Nafaa brigade, was arrested by locals in Foussana, Kasserine, while try to steal food. He was then handed over to national guards.

column6: Military Forces of Tunisia (2014-2019) National Guard
column17: Arrests: The national guard implemented a security campaign and arrested 78 suspected ""extremists"" in all of Tunisia.

A young man entered the Laala Police Station in Kairouan Governorate. The individual assaulted a police officer in charge of the reception with a wooden stick. A security patrol visited the scene and the perpetrator was arrested. The investigation is ongoing and the reasons for this intrusion remain unknown.
Unknown rioters threw molotov cocktails on a Russian tourist bus that was on its way from Douz to Tozeur. Noone was injured.
Inhabitants from Kef blocked National Road 5 in order to protest against water cuts that are affecting the city.

The medical staff of the regional hospital of Jbeniana was assaulted following the death of two young people,that died in a road accident. The families of the victims also broke the hospital equipment.

column9: Military Forces of Tunisia (2014-2019) National Guard
column17: A member of National Guard CT-unit found stabbed to death this morning in Sousse. Three arrested incl. 2 men and a woman for the killing. The defendants claim they stabbed the agent because he attempted to force their female friend into his car. A political motive can not be excluded.
Residents of the Ain Karma region of the Sakiet Sidi Youssef delegation in Kef carried out a demonstration on the national road n5 to protest against water cuts.

Unemployed people from the municipality of Regueb in the governorate of Sidi Bouzid protested today, thereby shutting down the local headquarters of Finance Ministry after they shut down the seat of the municipality yesterday. Protesters are calling for development and employment as well as jobs in the public institutions that will soon be set up in the region.

A number of teachers and substitute teachers organized a demonstration in front of the headquarters of the regional education delegation in Sfax and prevented the employees of this delegation from joining their offices.

Unemployed people from the municipality of Regueb in the governorate of Sidi Bouzid protested today, thereby shutting down the local headquarters of Finance Ministry after they shut down the seat of the municipality yesterday. Protesters are calling for development and employment as well as jobs in the public institutions that will soon be set up in the region.
Taxi drivers initiated a protest rally in support of their colleague who was assaulted by police officers in front of Bazma Civil Prison, Kebili.
Al Alaa residents have closed all public facilities today and blocked the road linking Al Alaa to Hezoua as a protest against water supply cuts.
A customs official that was recently transferred to Tabarka was found hanged in his house. It is unclear what the motives behind the killing were.

Tunisian farmers gathered on Thursday, September 07, 2017 at Kasbah Square to protest against the deterioration of their living conditions and to challenge the authorities on the problems the sector is facing.

A municipal police officer was assaulted with a knife this Friday in Tunis at the time he was performing his job. The police officer had seized in accordance with the decree of the governor of Tunis, the merchandise of a street vendor who had improvisationally set up his shop on the stret.

Citizens of Bouarada protested, thereby blocking the railway line at the local station, preventing the passage of trains in both directions. The protesters wanted to draw the attention of railway officials to the problems caused by the change in the timetable of certain trains, as well as the cancellation of certain shuttles.

Inhabitants from Giyada in Nefza staged a sit-in in front of the seat of seat of the prefecture in Nefza. They demand proper water supply and the set-up of infrastructure to better connect their villages.
Supporters from football club ""Club Africain"" staged a sit-in in front of the training stadium of the Club to denounce the mismanagement of the club by the executive committee.
Interim teachers form Kairouan staged a sit-in in front of the National Assembly to demand regulating their professional situation.

According to statements by recently arrested militants clashes between Ajnad al-Khilefa and the Okba Ibn Nafaa brigade took place on Mont Salloum. The statements indicate that this was caused by difficult living conditions in the mountains and ongoing Tunisian security operations.

Several protesters rallied outside the Municipial theatre in Tunis on Tuesday at the call of the ""Manish Msameh"" (I will not Forgive) group to protest against the foreseen adoption of the administrative amnesty bill in the national assembly. The bill will pardon many administrative employees under the Ben-Ali era.

column8: Military Forces of Tunisia (2014-2019) National Guard
column17: Units of the National Guard at the Kef dispersed a sit-in staged by students of the Higher Institute of Sports and Physical Education (ISSEP) wishing to enroll in master. According to the Institute's management, the protesters blocked the entrance of the establishment and interrupted the normal course of activity.
Inhabitants from Kef and al-Galaa paralyzed train-traffic between near Dahmani and Seres, in order to protest against the cancellation of the 4AM-train from Dahmani to Tunis.

Several people rallied outside the parliament on Wednesday at the call of the ""Manish Msameh"" (I will not Forgive) group to demand the immediate withdrawal of the administrative amnesty bill. The peaceful protest turned violent when people started to throw rocks on the police after they were prevented to enter the parliament. The bill will pardon many administrative employees under the Ben-Ali era.

Activists from civil society protested on Chelli-square in Sousse to protest against the recently passed administrative amnesty bill that will pardon thousands of bureaucrats who are accused of corruption under Ben-Ali rule.

Activists from the Popular Front marched on the streets of Gafsa to protest against the recently passed administrative amnesty bill that will pardon thousands of bureaucrats who are accused of corruption under Ben-Ali rule.
Unemployed graduates protested in Tozeur to demand development and jobs in the region.
A teacher in a school in Sousse was aggressed physically by parents of pupils of the school. They accuse her of being a non-believer and having a bad influence on the children.
Individuals who had been prevented from fishing on the coasts of the Kerkennah Islands by the Maritime Guard blocked the main port of the island, paralyzing ferry traffic.

Activists from civil society protested on the art-square in the center of Kairouan to protest against the recently passed administrative amnesty bill that will pardon thousands of bureaucrats who are accused of corruption under Ben-Ali rule.

Demonstrators from the Manich Msemah movement have gathered in Tunis to protest a controversial law passed by parliament, which grants amnesty to Ben Ali-era officials convicted of corruption offences if they agree to return any funds they acquired illegally.

Candidates who passed the exam to be recruited as bus drivers at the Transport Company 'Sahel' protested today in front of the Ministry of Transport because of irregularities in the aftermath of the exam. Moreover, the union of official and agents of judicial services belonging to the 'CGTT: Tunisian General Labour Confederation' entered into a 3-day strike to protest against non-fullfilment of demands made by the sector.
Parents of pupils in Ain Jenan, Foussana, closed the gates of the school as a sign of protest over the lack of teachers in the school.

column6: Military Forces of Tunisia (2014-2019) National Guard
column17: The National Guard reportedly shot dead a suspect, Nouicer Jedidi, on his way home from a nightly party in Ain Seidene, Jendouba.

A journalist from Diwan FM who covered a sit-in in Sfax in support of a teacher that was accused of blasphemy was aggressed and injured by police forces. Another journalist who then came to the police station to support his colleague was similarly aggressed by police forces.

A journalist from Diwan FM who covered a sit-in in Sfax in support of a teacher that was accused of blasphemy earlier was aggressed and injured by police forces. Another journalist who then came to the police station to support his colleague was similarly aggressed by police forces.
Unidentified rioters vandalised a primary school in Bizerte and stole equipment from inside.

column8: Military Forces of Tunisia (2014-2019) National Guard
column17: A group of citizens from the Ain Saidene region of the governorate of Jendouba invaded the National Guard station of their locality on Tuesday because they killed one of their friends the day before. No officer was injured.

column7: ISIE: Independent High Authority for Elections
column17: The 'Independent High Authority for Elections' (ISIE) went on a general strike in all of Tunisia on September 20 to demand a regularisation of their professional situation. Video shows employees chanting.
Police made use of teargas to disperse a sit-in in front of the SIAP-factory near Gabes.

Parents of students from primary school in Gataya, Kebili, installed tents inside the compound to allowed their children to go to school and to protest against lacking infrastructure at the school, e.g. the lack of walls against non-domesticated dogs et al.
Substitute Teachers from Ben Arous continued their protest movement to demand a regularisation of their professional situation.

Journalists and Civil Society Activists organized a protest in front of the security HQ of the region in Sfax to denounce the aggression of a Journalist from Diwan FM, Hamdi Soussi, earlier this week by police forces.
Tunisian police forces used teargas to disperse rioters that had blocked the main road in the village to demand the release of a street-vendor that recently had been arrested.
An old man stepped on a mine nearby the Doulab-Zone on Jebel Semmama. His leg had to be amputated.

The Skhira industrial zone had been blocked due to a sit-in by workers. They blocked a road leading to a company in the zone to demand employment and development for the region before proceeding to shut down the whole industrial zone.
Teachers and parents protested in front of the school in Korba against the high number of students. Classes therefore did not take place.
Teachers who recently passed an exam to teach in public institutions protested in front of regional prefectures to demand the government to employ them.
Teachers who recently passed an exam to teach in public institutions protested in front of regional prefectures to demand the government to employ them.
Teachers who recently passed an exam to teach in public institutions protested in front of regional prefectures to demand the government to employ them.
Hospital employees in Tataouine staged a sit-in to denounce the aggression of a nurse in the hospital.
A number of security guards carried out a protest in front of the ministry of social affairs.
Parents of students shut down a school in Bouhajla protesting against the lack of teaching personnel.
Parents of students shut down a primary school in Houareb, Chebika. The parents organized a protest march on the main road of the city to protest against the lack of teaching personnel.
Inhabitants from Homet Souk protested against the pollution and impurification of the city.
Employees of the 'Banque Franco-Tunisienne"" protested in front of the Ministry of Finance to intervene in the situation to make clear whether the bank will persist and be saved or go bankrupt.
Movement of forces: Tunisian Military forces indicated that military operations are taking place on the hills of Kasserine, searching for armed militants.
Looting: in Mazrak Chams near Jebel Semmama, presumed Okba ibn Nafaa militants raided homes of villagers and stole supplies.

Two families who had a quarrel during a wedding went to the hospital to be treated. After having to wait too long, the two families started to riot, fight against each other and ravaging the hospital. This is one of several incidents in which people started to riot in hospitals.
Soldier wounded in IED/mine blast at Jebel Semmama, Kasserine.
A soldier was severely beaten and sustained multiple fractures after being assaulted by a trio of militants near Kairouan.

People in Tataouine and Smar rioted and blocked streets with burning tires to protest against not being recruited for companies that belong to the big oil companies in the region - which was according to them foreseen in accords between the Tunisian government and protesters in El Kamour.

People in Tataouine and Smar rioted and blocked streets with burning tires to protest against not being recruited for companies that belong to the big oil companies in the region - which was according to them foreseen in accords between the Tunisian government and protesters in El Kamour.
A policeman fired shots as 4 people tried to seize his gun in a coordinated action. The policeman was able to ward off the assailants.
Inhabitants and youth from Jhina, Bouhajla, Kairouan decided to shut down the school and block traffic to protest against the lack of teaching personnel for schools.
Rioters from the UGTT invaded the seat of the UTICA-syndicate, aggressed the guardians and organised a sit-in in the hallway. UGTT denies having perpetrated the act.

column7: UTII: Tunisian Union of Individual Taxi Drivers
column17: Taxi drivers from the Tunisian Union of Individual Taxi Drivers, not recognized by General Syndicate UTICA, struck and protested in the capital Tunis. Demonstrations came after authorities failed to respond to drivers' demands including approval of the tariff increase and a review of their insurance system.

column7: UTII: Tunisian Union of Individual Taxi Drivers
column17: Taxi drivers from the Tunisian Union of Individual Taxi Drivers, not recognized by General Syndicate UTICA, struck and protested in the capital Tunis. Demonstrations came after authorities failed to respond to drivers' demands including approval of the tariff increase and a review of their insurance system.

The parents of pupils enrolled in secondary schools in the town of Ain Drahem demonstrated against schedules that do not take into consideration the distances and commuting time and difficult weather conditions of the region.
Residents of Djerba organized a demonstration in front of the delegation of Homet Souk denouncing the pollution of tap water.
Relatives of the victims from a collision between a Navy-ship and a ship carrying illegal immigrants, protested today, in front of the Kerkenah maritime barracks (governorate of Sfax).
More than 400 construction workers protested today in front of the seat of the local government to demand the payment of their salaries.

The parents of pupils enrolled in secondary schools in the town of Ain Drahem demonstrated against schedules that do not take into consideration the distances and commuting time and difficult weather conditions of the region.

The residents of Bir Ali Ben Khalifa blocked several roads. School classes were also suspended. They want to know what exactly happened in the collision between a boat of migrants and a Tunisian navy ship, where 4 young guys from the region died.

Students who passed the exam to obtain a professional master and then become professor went to the Ministry of Education and were met by Police Forces with excessive force. Several protesters were injured.

column7: UTII: Tunisian Union of Individual Taxi Drivers
column17: Taxi drivers who did not want to strike clashed with Taxi drivers from the Tunisian Union of Individual Taxi Drivers, not recognized by General Syndicate UTICA, who struck and protested in the capital Tunis. One taxi-driver tried to immolate himself but other taxi drivers stopped him. Demonstrations came after authorities failed to respond to drivers' demands including approval of the tariff increase and a review of their insurance system.
The residents of Bir Ali Ben Khalifa protested and blocked a road to protest over a ship accident earlier the week, in which relatives died.

Residents in Kebili burned tires to block crossroads in the city to protest against the death of 4 young people from the region. The young inhabitants died in an accident between two ships earlier this week.

Rioters in Souk Lahad set the seat of the local government on fire before walking to the security post and clashing there with security forces. The riots took place because death of four young people from the region, when a boat of clandestine migrants collided with a ship from the Tunisian Navy. Noone was injured.

Rioters threw stones on an ambulance in Sfax and injured a doctor and a nurse. This event follows several events in Tunisia last week, during which hospitals were vandalized and medical personnel attacked.

Inhabitants of Ben Guardane, staged a sit-in in front of the local governmental representation to protest over the death of 4 young teenagers from the region in an accident between two boats earlier this week.
Unidentified gunmen invaded farmers in the outskirts of Kairouan. They injured some farmers with shots who had to be transported to the hospital.
Inhabitants from Souk Lahad protested in front of the seat of the governorate to call for the liberation of several people that have been arrested in riots with the police the week before.
Infrastructural workers protested in front of the municipality of the city to protest against non-kept promises from the local government with regards to their socio-economic conditions.
Several teachers who successfully passed an exam to be recruited for superior jobs protested in front of the National Assembly because the government did not recruit them as promised.

In accordance with a general strike, a protest march was organized in Bir el Hafey. Protesters ask for development, employment and clarification with regards to what happened with several young people from the region who died in a boat accident with National Marine.

Inhabitants from Regueb went on a general strike and protested physically to ask for compensations for the perished young guys from the region that died in a boat accident with the National Marine the week before.

University professors staged a sit-in in front of the headquarters of the Ministry of Higher Education and Scientific Research. They demand academic liberty and non-intervention of the state in their affairs.
Protests took place in Soukra after a member of parliament inspected a school in Soukra with regards to verify recent complaints about scarce teaching personnel.
Disabled people protested in front of the seat of the governorate in Medenine to denounce insufficient ramps and access to public transport.
Voiceless people organised a protest in front of the Municipal Theatre in Tunis to pressure the government to keep its promises with regards to employment
Inhabitants of Hammad, Jedaida, blocked the road leading to Tebourba with tires to protest against perils on roads after a woman died in an accident.
Inhabitants of Hammad, Jedaida, blocked the road leading to Tebourba with tires to protest against perils on roads after a woman died in an accident.

Agents from the Chamber of Trade and Industry organized a protest in front of the seat of the chamber in Gafsa to denounce the negligence of authorities towards the financial crisis. Two members of the National Assembly joined the protest.

A general strike and a protest march took place in Bir ali Ben Khalifa to protest against misinformation regarding the recent death of 45 people caused by a boat crash in Kerkennah. They also demand an improvement of their socio-economic situation.

""Barbed men"" attacked a bar in Al Jorf in Derba after it had reopened after a long period of restauration. They occupied the bar and sent home the costumers. Security forces intervened to sort out the situation.

Employees of the 'Institut superieur des etudes technologiques' in Tozeur organised a protest in Tozeur in solidarity with technical workers from the institute who protested in Tunis to call for a clarification in their legal status.

Employees of the 'Institut superieur des etudes technologiques' in Tozeur organised a protest in Tozeur in solidarity with technical workers from the institute who protested in Tunis to call for a clarification in their legal status.

In protest of scarce teaching personnel in schools in Sidi Boubaker, Gafsa, parents of students and their children closed the post office, the headquarters of the Delegation and the Lycee to draw the attention of local and regional officials on the situation in the region.
Security forces announced that they regained full control of Jebel Ouergha and the Kef mountains.

After hooligans from 2 football clubs were rioting against each other in Helal, Tunis, throwing stones and using knifes, police intervened to stop the riots. The police however was heavily attacked by the hooligans which led to 4 policemen being injured and six policecars being damaged. Several hooligans were arrested.

Inhabitants of Tataouine blocked roads with burning tires to show their insatisfaction with the results of competitive exams to be recruited for satellite companies of oil companies in the region. The exams were foreseen in the agreements to put an end to the month-long protests in Oued el Kamour several months ago.
Civil Society organized a protest march in Gabes to call for the swift completion of the construction of a new hospital.
Three Islamist 'extremists' assaulted a young man in Kairouan because of his un-Islamic behaviour. The young man had to be hospitalised.
Inhabitants from Monastir protested and prevented former President Moncef Marzouki from entering a local radio station.

Dozens of professors admitted to CAPES, protested outside of the House of Representatives and tried to enter by force to meet deputies. Present security forces however, dissuaded them from trying to force their way.
Retired policemen gathered in front of the House of Representatives to protest against irregularities during their professional career and exclusion from an agreement to iron out the irregularities.
A police commander was stabbed in the neck and killed by an ""Islamist extremist"" in Tunis.

column8: Military Forces of Tunisia (2014-2019) National Guard
column17: National Guard officer (corporal) wounded by mine/IED explosion at Jebel es-Sif (Foussana), Kasserine near Algeria border.
A young man, reportedly inspired by Islamist extremism, stabbed two policemen in front of the Tunisian parliament before being arrested. One of the two policemen later died from his injuries..

Policemen demonstrated in front of the hospital in which an injured policeman died after an attack the day before. Protesters demand that parliament adopt a law on ""protecting"" them against unlawful attacks.
Medical workers in Sidi Bouzid governorate staged a sit-in in front of the regional health directorate to denounce recurring attacks on them.

column16: La Presse (Tunisia); Tunisie Numerique; Mosaique FM
column17: Rioters in Zarzis blocked streets with burning tires to denounce disrespectful police behaviour towards the inhabitants. A young guy immolated himself because of the disrespect and had to be hospitalised. The police clashed with rioters and intervened with teargas to disperse them. 4 policemen were injured.
A young shepherd was wounded by the explosion of a mine/IED at Jebel Chaambi, Kasserine.
Attempted vehicular attack by an unidentified man targeted two soldiers in El Baten, Kairouan. No injuries were caused. The attacker is on the run.

Hundreds of Tunisian policemen demonstrated in Sfax, Gabes, Bizerte and Siliana, demanding that parliament adopt a law on ""protecting"" them against unlawful attacks, after one policeman was killed in an attack two days before. Civil groups have called the law ""dangerous"" for democracy.

Hundreds of Tunisian policemen demonstrated in Sfax, Gabes, Bizerte and Siliana, demanding that parliament adopt a law on ""protecting"" them against unlawful attacks, after one policeman was killed in an attack two days before. Civil groups have called the law ""dangerous"" for democracy.

Hundreds of Tunisian policemen demonstrated in Sfax, Gabes, Bizerte and Siliana, demanding that parliament adopt a law on ""protecting"" them against unlawful attacks, after one policeman was killed in an attack two days before. Civil groups have called the law ""dangerous"" for democracy.

Hundreds of Tunisian policemen demonstrated in Sfax, Gabes, Bizerte and Siliana, demanding that parliament adopt a law on ""protecting"" them against unlawful attacks, after one policeman was killed in an attack two days before. Civil groups have called the law ""dangerous"" for democracy.

column9: Military Forces of Tunisia (2014-2019) National Guard
column17: Police Forces used teargas to disperse hooligans from Club African de Dehiba who invaded the stadium. An agent from the National Guard was injured by hooligans from Club African who threw stones at him.

Protests in Redeyef against the results of an exam to be recruited for the CPG turned violent swiftly. Rioters then blocked roads with burning tires before attacking the posts of the police force and the national guard which they burned down completely. Some security forces clashed with rioters before they fled. No injuries were reported.
Teaching & administrative personnel at a school in Manouba staged a sit-in to protest against the rising number of attacks on them.

Young inhabitants who were dissatisified with results of an exam to be recruited for the phosphate company in Gafsa blocked the road in Metlaoui with burning tires. Police Forces clashed with rioters and used teargas to disperse them.
A dispute between two individuals resulted in a knife fight between two clans in Dar Chaabene Fehri, Nabeul. Two persons were injured.
Three soldiers were wounded in two separate explosions of two mines in the closed military zone of Chaambi.

The regional union of national security organized a protest in Jerba. Police, National Guard, Civil Protection and Custom Workers protested, calling for the ratification of a law that foresees to increase the punishment for agressions against security forces.
Property destruction: Unknown men set the house of a policeman in Sousse on fire. No one was injured.
Protesters from the National Water Distrubution Company (SONEDE) protested in front of the seat of the company in Gafsa.
Young protesters blocked the road between Tatouine and Medenine to call for a speeding-up in the provision of micro-credits for them.
An individual who killed his mother with a knife resisted an arrest attempt by a policeman in Kairouan and heavily injured the policeman who had to be hospitalised.
Security forces from the Interior Ministry organised a march and a protest in Monastir to call for the implementation of a law that stipulates serious penalties for agressing security forces.
People rioted in front of a school in Bousalem against the return to a system of trimesters instead of semesters. The riots injured some pupils and damaged some cars.
Pupils protested in front of several schools in Jendouba against the return to a system of trimesters instead of semesters.

The regional syndicate of the force of the Interior Ministry organised a protest in front of the Bardo to denounce the recent aggressions by rioters & militants against them and called for the adoption of a controversial law.
Looting: A group of 4 presumed ISIS/Jund al-Khilafah militants raided a home for supplies last night in Selta, adjacent to Jebel Mghila.

column8: Military Forces of Tunisia (2014-2019) National Guard
column17: A seriously injured agent from the National Guard was discovered in Metline by inhabitants.
Construction workers in Medenine protested in front of the seat of the governorate to show their solidarity with colleagues in Tunis.

column7: PF: Popular Front; CD: Democratic Current
column17: Civil Society acctivists protested in front of the National Assembly against a controversial 'security law' which stipulates high penalties for resisting and attacking security forces. The protest was supported by the Popular Front and the Democratic current parliamentary blocs.
Merchants who trade with imported products on a market blocked a street leading to the market with burning tires and other obstacles to prevent customs inspection to check and seize their products.
Taxi drivers protested in Medenine against the municipality tipping construction waste at their taxi station.

Students protested in front of the seat of the prefecture in Medenine after being deprived of the right to an internship in the final phase of their studies. Moreover, parents of pupils from a school in Medenine protested against lacking teaching personnel in the school.
Civil Society acctivists protested in front of the municipial theater against a controversial security law which stipulates high penalties for resisting and attacking security forces.
Citizens and civil society activists organised a protest in Sfax against the installation of a statue of former president Habib Bourguiba. They claim that Bourguiba marginalised Sfax in his projects.

Tunisian residents block the road leading to the Libyan-Tunisian border between 22 and 26 November. The shutdown came after the Libyan Customs Department had seized goods for residents of Dehiba town on the Tunisian side

Construction workers organized a march in the streets of the city of Jendouba on the morning of Wednesday, November 22, 2017 to call the authorities to improve their wages to enable them to survive the constant rise in prices.
The Popular Front (FP) organized a series of protest movements at the Habib Bourguiba Avenue in the capital, to demand the full truth about the assassination of Chokri Belaid and Mohamed Brahmi.
The UGTT union protest over marginalization and lack of development in the area.

Tunisian residents block the road leading to the Libyan-Tunisian border between 22 and 26 November. The shutdown came after the Libyan Customs Department had seized goods for residents of Dehiba town on the Tunisian side

column7: ATSM: Tunisian Association for the Support of Minorities
column17: Tunisian Association for the Support of Minorities protest outside the Libyan embassy in Tunis against slavery.

Tunisian residents block the road leading to the Libyan-Tunisian border between 22 and 26 November. The shutdown came after the Libyan Customs Department had seized goods for residents of Dehiba town on the Tunisian side

column7: UCAO: Union of Customs Agents and Officials
column17: The unified union of Tunisian customs officers observed today a protest rally outside the headquarters of the regional customs office at the port of Bizerte .

A demonstration was held Saturday, November 25 in Tunis against a bill giving more rights to the agents of the security forces. The text offers the police the means to defend themselves, but the demonstrators denounce the bill as granting police impunity.

Tunisian residents block the road leading to the Libyan-Tunisian border between 22 and 26 November. The shutdown came after the Libyan Customs Department had seized goods for residents of Dehiba town on the Tunisian side
The inhabitants and activists of Kalaa Seghira demonstrated today 25 November 2017 against the emissions of gas from a brickyard.
A forest guard was severely wounded (right leg amputated) by the detonation of an IED/mine yesterday in the area of Jebel Abd El Adim (Chaambi),

Tunisian residents block the road leading to the Libyan-Tunisian border between 22 and 26 November. The shutdown came after the Libyan Customs Department had seized goods for residents of Dehiba town on the Tunisian side.
Protesters in Gafsa demand their immediate recruitment by the Ministry of Education as secondary school teachers.
The owners of the ready-to-wear stores and their employees protested outside the headquarters of the Sfax governorate.
An Islamist is killed by military in Jebel Tioucha Kasserine during gunbattle. A second is 'hit' but no information on whether he was killed.

Workers of a Tunisian rubber wheels company protested in front of the Ministry of Industry calling for the implementation of decisions agreed upon after negotiations between the UGTT, the government and the owner of the company.
A protest for development and employment took place in Meknassi, calling also for a swift completion of the phosphate mine project.

More than 90% of secondary education professors and teachers in Tunisia participated in a general strike to protest against bad working conditions. Several physical protests took place as well without specification where.
Tunisians protested to denounce the US decision to recognize Jerusalem as Israels capital.
Protests in Medenine, Siliana, SidiBouzid, Tataouine, Kasserine, Tozeur, Kebili in reaction to Trump's decision to recognize Jerusalem as Israels capital.
